intro: Lobivia acanthoplegma var. patula, commonly known as the Patula Lobivia, is a compact, short-stemmed cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It features dense, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly hairs that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a delicate touch of color to its otherwise muted appearance. Its leaves are reduced to spines, typical of many desert cacti, which aid in protection from herbivores and extreme weather. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
